context: Can you Turn off the BackLit LED anytime or no? And does the mouse have LED as well. Can I turn that off as well. What is the warranty on this?
response: The keyboard LED can be turned on and off at any time. The mouse can not be turned off. the warranty I don't remember you could check with Amazon about that.

context: can I do batting only for both sides?
response: Yes, you can.  Every time you save the game,  you can bat or bowl for either side at any stage of the game. So let's say if you lose the toss and you have to bowl, then save the game, and when you access it again,  you  can choose to bat for the opposition.

context: Does the keys light up in the dark. If it doesnt how do u know what you're pressing when its dark
response: No, they don't light up, and so the answer is, you don't know what you're pressing when it's dark.  So I don't recommend using it in the dark.  :-)

context: Do these actually support 1080i? From what I know the wii only supports 480p, unless they are talking about the wii u.
response: Not on a regular Wii. The Wii can only go up to 480p. The WiiU goes to 1080i. I bought this for my WiiU since I had now have to use it's HDMI slot for my Cable box.it supports 1080i On the WiiU, but the wii can only go up to 480p

context: Any big difference Gaming wise between the backlit version and the standard version? And about the keys,  the stealth or the clicky one?
response: Not between the chroma and original but the stealth version is quite a bit quieter than the click one. (The stealth sounds like browns while the clicky sounds like blues). I prefer the stealth so if you're playing a button masher you're not overwhelmed with clicking sounds.

context: Does it come with bluetooth dongle? Mine came without it and I don't know how to connect it to PC
response: It doesn't come with one so you will have to buy one separately if you want to play wirelessly or else you will have to use the USB cable to connect to your PC.
